content: gray yarn sew the beak onto the head of the pigeon as shown leave a small gap before finishing sewing to fill the inside of the 14 pigeon purse crochet pattern / emcrafting use tail to sew the toes/claws together partially connecting them into more of a foot adding the bag strap shape first attach the two d-rings to the purse the first d-ring should be attached to the end of the tail and the second should be attached to the top of the head as shown repeat steps to crochet a second foot using a tapestry needle and the long tail sew the feet onto the body of the purse as shown weave in ends invisibly 15 pigeon purse crochet pattern / emcrafting next you will attach the strap itself join the strap to one end of the bag first by inserting it into the d-ring and secure by sewing either hand-sewn or a straight stitch on a machine works fine to ensure the bag strap is the right length for you try it on as you insert the other end of the strap into the second d-ring and pin it at a length that hangs comfortably across your chest as a crossbody bag cut the excess strap material and sew where pinned the finished purse is intended to fit as shown below 16 pigeon purse crochet pattern / emcrafting copyright 2025 by emma manos ravelry https //www ravelry com/designers/emcrafting / tiktok @emcrafting this pattern is for personal use only 17
